notes: Strontium isotopic composition of shallow-marine carbonate
Stable carbon isotopic composition of shallow-marine carbonate; called "DLCOC" in BASIC code
Stable sulfur isotopic composition of shallow-marine carbonate; called "DLSOC" in BASIC code
Effect of relief on chemical weathering at time (t) relative to the present-day
Land area covered by carbonates at time (t) relative to the present-day
Land area at time (t) relative to the present-day
Global river runoff at time (t) relative to the present-day in the absence of changes in solar luminosity and CO2
Fraction of land area undergoing chemical weathering
Coefficient of continental runoff versus temperature change, where fD=1+RT*(T-T0)

Change in land mean surface temperature that is undergoing chemical weathering  at time (t) relative to the present-day in the absence of changes in solar luminosity and CO2 (see p. 35 in Berner 2004)
Seafloor creation rate at time (t) relative to the present-day
Effect of carbonate content of subducting oceanic crust on CO2 degassing rate at time (t) relative to the present-day; 0.75 for >150 Ma, then ramps up linearly to 1 at present-day
Activation energy for dissolution of Ca- and Mg-silicates on land. 0.03 is equivalent to 20 kJ/mol, 0.08 to 55 kJ/mol, and 0.13 to 90 kJ/mol (ACT = DE/RTTo; see p. 28 in Berner 2004).
Activation energy for dissolution of carbonates on land
Rate of chemical weathering in volcanic silicate rocks relative to non-volcanic silicate rocks
Coefficient relating physical erosion to the mean 87Sr/86Sr of non-volcanic silicate rocks
Exponent relating physical erosion to the mean 87Sr/86Sr of non-volcanic silicate rocks
Rate of chemical weathering in a minimally-vegetated world relative to present-day (angiosperm-dominated world)
Rate of chemical weathering by gymnosperms relative to angiosperms
Exponent reflecting the fraction of vegetation whose growth is stimulated by elevated CO2; FERT is related to enhanced chemical weathering by the Michaelis-Menton expression [2RCO2/(1+RCO2)]^FERT
Exponent used to describe the effect of climate on silicate or carbonate weathering in the absence of vascular plants at time (t) relative to the present-day
Climate sensitivity; [compare this to G ("GCM") factor, where deltaT2X = G * ln(2)]
Factor by which deltaT2X changes during times with large continental icesheets

Coefficient used to calculate CAPd13C (called "alphac" in BASIC code), the stable carbon isotopic fractionation between shallow-marine carbonate and shallow-marine organic matter; CAPd13C = 27+J*(oxygen/38-1)
Exponent used to calculate CAPd34S (called "alphas" in BASIC code), the stable sulfur isotopic fractionation between shallow-marine CaSO4 sulfur and pyrite sulfur; CAPd34S = 35((oxygen/38)^n)
Effect on temperature from the linear increase in solar luminosity over time
Exponent that scales the dilution of dissolved HCO3- with runoff (fD)
Sulfate flux from oxidative weathering of old pyrite at present-day
Sulfate flux from weathering of CaSO4 sulfur at present-day
Carbon flux from weathering of old sedimentary organic matter at present-day
Carbon flux from weathering of old Ca and Mg carbonates at present-day
Carbon degassing flux from volcanism, metamorphism, and diagenesis of organic matter at present-day
Carbon degassing flux from volcanism, metamorphism, and diagenesis of carbonates at present-day
Sulfur degassing flux from volcanism, metamorphism, and diagenesis of pyrite at present-day
Sulfur degassing flux from volcanism, metamorphism, and diagenesis of CaSO4 sulfur at present-day
Weathering flux for all Ca and Mg silicates at present-day
Fraction of total Ca and Mg silicate weathering derived from volcanic rocks at present-day
Stable carbon isotopic fractionation between shallow-marine carbonate and shallow-marine organic matter at present-day
Stable sulfur isotopic fractionation between shallow-marine CaSO4 sulfur and pyrite sulfur at present-day
Mass of atmospheric O2 (7.5 and 143 correspond to 5% and 50% O2) at 570 Myrs ago
Mass of young crustal organic carbon at 570 Myrs ago (value in Berner 2006a is a typo)
Mass of young crustal carbonate carbon at 570 Myrs ago (value in Berner 2006a is a typo)
Mass of old crustal carbonate carbon at 570 Myrs ago (value in Berner 2006a is a typo)

Mass of young pyrite sulfur at 570 Myrs ago

d34S of young pyrite sulfur at 570 Myrs ago
d34S of old pyrite sulfur at 570 Myrs ago

d13C of old organic matter at 570 Myrs ago

87Sr/86Sr of old carbonates undergoing weathering at 570 Myrs ago
